column5: I finished off the deer hunting season unsuccessfully with my final hunt on Newyears Eve.  Newyears day - On to a new season!  HARDWATER!!  Made plans with fellow board member Livinisfishin and headed out for some Crappie new years day.  Iced a few perch, moved around a lot.  No Crappie.  Nice day though!   Figuring out the new electronics    Saturday morning I found some early G-bay ice.  Was hoping for pike or walleye.  Skunked on my morning spot.  Head to the evening spot to check the ice there.  It was sketchy getting on the ice, but once on, 4" of solid clear ice.  This picture was 1 shot with the spud.  The while cracking is the bottom of the ice.    I tiptoed around, spudding holes all over place looking for the depth I had stuck in my head.  Started to get close to the depth, and right away was lifting perch.  Moved a few more times till I got right on it..  Then Wham!  First drag scream of the year!  And with the ice so clear, I had a great view of the fight!  22"  Smack on the top of the slot..   So that was a great moment.    Followed by a BAD moment when I walked back to my gear and perch rod about 75 yards away only to find that my rod, reel, and rod holder where snatched by a big fish, and ripped down the hole....  :wallbash:  Sunday I met up with Livinisfishin again.  We're really craving the crappie now.  A crappie skunk to start the season.  It was time for redemption!  Went a little further north this time.  The ice was very sketchy.  The hole claimed another victim! When my fishing partner went to drop in his transducer, and his cell phone fell from his pocket smack in the center of the hole..  Down she went!  Took a lot of moving around to get them.  30' of water.  Minnows.  Ended the day with 4 around 10" and another 8 in the 6-8" range.  I'm eating them as I type!!

Looks like your having a great time! My uncles been having a very difficult time on G-Bay with walleye. He is a scuba diver so when he does his dives he always sees them, and there right infront of his channel. He's had that cottage for many many year and can't get them on a hook. Only seen one actually hooked by his cottage and it wasnt his haha.
Good stuff Nick!  Thanx for the pix.
Sweet BBB, I'm ready to get my butt out there, hopefully soon!
They can be tough to figure out.  I've been skunked many times on G-bay.  Thanks Brian!  And thanks to all you other folks that checked out my report!
It's early Jan and you've got quite a few fish under your belt! Congrats!

That sucks about the lost tip up and phone (Im kind of laughing though). Lots of people losing tip ups this year haha.  That's a sweet walleye. I really wish we had clear black ice like that, but, then again, we have like 6-12 inches, so I can't really complain.  Anyway, great report. I'm gonna get in touch with you soon for a Nip trip in february.
good stuff bud..  great start the the year
Alright, Nick let's meet halfway somewhere so you can teach me how to find crappies.

Sure thing!  We might be done with them for the year though.  Walleye this weekend coming.  Back lake spec adventure the next.  Then I'm really hoping the following week will be Simcoe whities.  Maybe in the spring!
What a cool start to the season...too bad about the rod...but like Chad said...did make me chuckle a bit. Keep, email coming.....how ya liking your new electronics so far?
Thanks Limey!  I've had my finder for a long time.  It was Livinisfishing who got the new gear.  I think he's starting to figure it out.  A 343C. There are a prefect little unit for the ice
A beauty start to your hard water fishing Nick Thanks for sharing TJunkie
